original_title: Xi Jinping makes rare visit to Tibet to showcase control as Dalai Lama succession looms | CNN
article_summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping visited Tibet in August 2025, marking a break with precedent as the first top leader to attend the region's decennial celebration. The trip comes amidst a looming struggle over the successor of the aging and exiled Dalai Lama, with Xi emphasizing the need for political stability and religious harmony in Tibet. The Dalai Lama, who has been in exile since 1959, has stated that his successor will be born outside China, setting him on a collision course with China's Communist Party over the authority to approve the next Dalai Lama.</s>
